description.narrative:
L’assistance technique est un soutien non financier fourni par des spécialistes. Elle peut revêtir plusieurs formes : partage d’information et de savoir-faire, formation et services-conseils.
L’assistance technique fournie dans le cadre du PEF est appelée aide ciblée aux pays. Ce type de soutien vise principalement à payer le personnel basé en permanence dans les bureaux pays des partenaires. Il repose sur la demande et les besoins identifiés par les pays eux-mêmes.

Technical assistance is non-financial support provided by specialists. It can take the form of sharing information and expertise, training and consulting services.
The technical assistance provided through PEF is called targeted country assistance (TCA). This type of support mainly consists of staff permanently based in partners’ country offices. It is based on the demand and needs identified by the countries themselves.

Cette activité détaille notre travail sur le Aide ciblée aux pays en Kirghizistan (le), grâce à la mise à disposition des données budgétaires et des transactions. Nous fournissons également les documents pertinents qui guident ces activités que sont les formulaires de demande de soutien fournis par le gouvernement de Kirghizistan (le) ainsi que les lettres de décisions émises par Gavi, pour progresser. Ces documents décrivent les activités, les objectifs ainsi que les bénéficiaires.

This activity details our work on Targeted country assistance in Kyrgyzstan through the provision of budget and transaction data. We also provide the relevant documents that guide these activities, which are the support request proposal(s) provided by the Government of Kyrgyzstan, as well as the decision letter(s) issued by Gavi, for progress. These documents describe the activities, the objectives as well as the beneficiaries.

target.value: - The request for TCA support focuses on strengthening quality of primary health care services, following from the World Bank's previous TCA focus, which designed PHC payment systems to better reward quality. The support will have syngeries with an upcomi

- The request for TCA support focuses on strengthening quality of primary health care services, following from the World Bank's previous TCA focus, which designed PHC payment systems to better reward quality. The support will have syngeries with an upcoming World Bank Program-for-Results (PforR) operation on ?PHC Quality Improvement". -The focus of the work is to design tool(s) to actively collect patient reported experience measures (PREMs) with service quality and provide feedback to the PHC providers on a continuous basis. - Understanding patients' perspective of their experience of care is increasingly seen as key to making health care systems more people-centered and ultimately successful at delivering quality services and health outcomes. This is particularly relevant to immunization, where service is free and yet uptake is not 100%. Understanding patients' perspective and incorporating them into the PHC service delivery will help make the services more responsive and attractive to the patients. - Some data on patient-satisfaction is collected in Kyrgyzstan (for instance in the context of the Balance Score Card (BSC) used by MHIF in results-based financing) but the questions are not specific and the data are insufficiently used by managers to improve care on a continuous basis. - Gavi TCA would support the work to design an effective and modern tool, or tools, to capture patient perspectives and provide feedback to PHC providers on a continuous basis. Likely, the work will start with an in-depth qualitative assessment of the patient perception on quality and content of care, care processes, interaction with providers, and payment aspects. The results of this qualitative assessment, together with a review of instruments used in other countries, will then inform the development of a structured tool and its validation. It will also inform how to pilot the tool and ultimately embed it in the continuous quality improvement mechanism to make services more responsive to the patients, especially vulnerable groups including women and small children. Immunization and MCH will be central in these services.

- The request for TCA support focuses on strengthening quality of primary health care services, following from the World Bank's previous TCA focus, which designed PHC payment systems to better reward quality. The support will have syngeries with an upcomi

title.narrative: - Review of experience for collecting data on patient experience at PHC level - Qualitative assessment of patient perception and content of care: strategy fialised and data collection on-going

target.value: - The request for TCA support focuses on strengthening quality of primary health care services, following from the World Bank's previous TCA focus, which designed PHC payment systems to better reward quality. The support will have syngeries with an upcoming World Bank Program-for-Results (PforR) operation on ?PHC Quality Improvement". -The focus of the work is to design tool(s) to actively collect patient reported experience measures (PREMs) with service quality and provide feedback to the PHC providers on a continuous basis. - Understanding patients' perspective of their experience of care is increasingly seen as key to making health care systems more people-centered and ultimately successful at delivering quality services and health outcomes. This is particularly relevant to immunization, where service is free and yet uptake is not 100%. Understanding patients' perspective and incorporating them into the PHC service delivery will help make the services more responsive and attractive to the patients. - Some data on patient-satisfaction is collected in Kyrgyzstan (for instance in the context of the Balance Score Card (BSC) used by MHIF in results-based financing) but the questions are not specific and the data are insufficiently used by managers to improve care on a continuous basis. - Gavi TCA would support the work to design an effective and modern tool, or tools, to capture patient perspectives and provide feedback to PHC providers on a continuous basis. Likely, the work will start with an in-depth qualitative assessment of the patient perception on quality and content of care, care processes, interaction with providers, and payment aspects. The results of this qualitative assessment, together with a review of instruments used in other countries, will then inform the development of a structured tool and its validation. It will also inform how to pilot the tool and ultimately embed it in the continuous quality improvement mechanism to make services more responsive to the patients, especially vulnerable groups including women and small children. Immunization and MCH will be central in these services.

target.value: Revise and/or develop budgeting tools on procurement of vaccines.
